p: On the other hand, the possible inhibition of inflammatory processes has not been studied in eremanthin ( 4). However, this compound has a rigid skeleton and an intact exo-methylene-γ-lactone group, previously related to anti-inflammatory properties ( Simonsen et al., 2013). Additionally, the absence of free hydroxyl groups in 4 could help to improve anti-inflammatory properties since an increasing number of free hydroxyl groups are reported to diminish NF-κB inhibition activity ( Simonsen et al., 2013). Taking together these structural characteristics, we suggest that eremathin ( 4) is a candidate to be tested for inhibition of inflammatory processes related to metabolic diseases.
